creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: bust of a male figure with narrowed eyes, with a smirk and a large nose, wearing a large hat; ruffles at collar
marks:
Stamp

in graphite on verso, bottom of sheet: 4
provenance: Max Egon Fürst zu Fürstenberg (1863-1941); sale, Sotheby's, London, lot 415, June 1982; [David Tunick, New York, until June 1982, sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Laughing Peasant
